unnormalised: Delhi is seeing a surge in cases of "Delhi Belly," or as the docs at AIIMS are calling it, acute infectious gastroenteritis. Apparently, too many folks are skipping the ghar ka khana and indulging in street food. Dr. Sharma quipped, "Looks like everyone's competing to break the record for most trips to the loo!"
normalised: delhi is seeing a surge in cases of "delhi belly," or as the doctors at A-I-I-M-S are calling it, acute infectious gastroenteritis. apparently, too many folks are skipping the ghar ka khana and indulging in street food. doctor sharma quipped, "looks like everyone's competing to break the record for most trips to the loo!"

unnormalised: The Health Min. reports a 200% increase in cases compared to last month. They're advising everyone to stick to boiled water and avoid those tempting golgappas from the vendor near Sec 17. The last thing anyone wants is to spend their Diwali running to the bathroom, not lighting diyas.
normalised: the health minister reports a two hundred percent increase in cases compared to last month. they're advising everyone to stick to boiled water and avoid those tempting golgappas from the vendor near sector seventeen. the last thing anyone wants is to spend their diwali running to the bathroom, not lighting diyas.

unnormalised: The symptoms, as per a circular issued by the local MCD, include nausea, vomiting, and frequent trips to the washroom – basically, a crash course in plumbing. Experts suggest ORS (oral rehydration solution) and a bland diet. Avoid spicy food like the plague.
normalised: the symptoms, as per a circular issued by the local M-C-D, include nausea, vomiting, and frequent trips to the washroom – basically, a crash course in plumbing. experts suggest O-R-S (oral rehydration solution) and a bland diet. avoid spicy food like the plague.

unnormalised: So, if you want to enjoy the festive season without any "explosive" surprises, maybe skip that extra plate of chaat. Remember, good health is the best gift you can give yourself (and your family, who definitely won't appreciate you hogging the toilet). Stay safe, folks!
normalised: so, if you want to enjoy the festive season without any "explosive" surprises, maybe skip that extra plate of chaat. remember, good health is the best gift you can give yourself (and your family, who definitely won't appreciate you hogging the toilet). stay safe, folks!
